summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding the OIG's draft report on the investigation and review of BOP's custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It requests BOP to conduct a factual accuracy and sensitivity review of the draft report by April 19, 2023, and outlines restrictions on dissemination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG's draft report investigating the Federal Bureau of Prisons' custody, care, and supervision of him at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Deadline for BOP Review and Response

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ OIG has prepared a draft report investigating the BOP's handling of Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The OIG is providing the draft report to BOP for a factual accuracy and sensitivity review prior to public release.
BOP's review and any formal response are due by April 19, 2023, with no extensions granted.
The memorandum strictly prohibits dissemination or discussion of the draft report outside of necessary BOP employees involved in the review.
The OIG requests that BOP maintain a log of who accesses the draft report.
